summary: despite the number of studies reported to date, the causative agents of pneumonia are not completely known. we found vegetable and tobacco DNA may be detected in the bronchoalveolar lavage from patients with ventilator-associated pneumonia. pneumonia may occur as a consequence of the passage of foreign material into the respiratory tracts. it has been reported that aspiration of foreign matter may occur easily among ICU patients. this type of pneumonia may represent a serious cause of illness and mortality among ICU patients [7], [8]. inhalation was confirmed in a total of 7 patients out of the 106 cases. 4 were positive for plant DNA (57%). inhalation was significantly frequent in patients with plant DNA. three of these six plant-positive patients had a history for pneumonia at the admission (cases 2, 5 and 6). available Clinical data showed that three of these six plant-positive patients had a history for pneumonia at the admission.
